Summary: Appeared to be a dull orange object, looking a lot like a planet, about 20 degrees above the horizon in the e/ne sky. Flared up, changed flight direction and flew off.
divs: sighting detailsi can't say for sure what it was. my wife and i were out in the front yard, which faces the hills across the valley. it looks out in an e\ne direction. i was smoking, looking at the moon. there was a litle haze, and some partial\light clouds. i could see most of the brighter stars, the dipper, etc., and planes were visible on their normal flight routes. when i turned back towards the hills, i saw a light orange object, planet-like, next to the hill, about 20 degrees above the horizon. i was surprised, because i hadn't noticed it before. it wasn't in the right place to be a planet, but that's what it appeared to be. there was a jet flying along its normal approximate s\n route, which passes a little more than thumbs width above the hill. i watched it for a bit, because it seemed out of place, and my wife has seen orange balls doing erratic things in the sky on several occasions at night over the last few years. i watched it for a minute or so, and it didn't seem to move at all. i thought that maybe i was wrong, as it had a slightly wavering quality, like a twinkling star, and i began to think it really was a planet, and i was off my bearings. i bent over to pet the cat, and when i looked back up, i could swear it had moved a bit to the right. i thought maybe my eyes were playing tricks on me, so i stood perfectly still and took a bearing off of the hill, my van and the tree next to it. after a bit, i was sure it was slowly moving to the right. at this point, it stopped, and over maybe 2-3 seconds, it dramatically increased in size and brilliance. it had a flux quality as it increased in brightness. not like a strobe, but wavering, as it rapidly increased in brilliance. it grew to about the size of a matchhead held at arms length, maybe slightly smaller, and it was roughly the brightness of the moon, maybe a bit brighter. i started to wonder if it was some sort of flare, but it didn't hold the peak intensity but maybe a second or two, then declined at the same rate as it had increased, returning to its original appearance and luminosity. after returning to its original state, it changed direction, going back to the left, and it sped up. it appeared to be moving at a similar rate to the jets that routinely pass over. as it moved away, i started to wonder again if it was an aircraft, because i could make out a dim blinking light. it passed behind the hill, and i didn't see it again. over the next 45 minutes, i saw several jets pass over on their regular routes, but nothing else strange. the only thing i can even remotely think off that would explain what i saw is some sort of helicopter. that would explain the stationary positioning and the change in directions. but for most of the sighting, it appeared to be a single orangish light. i didn't hear any engine noise or rotors. it doesn't explain the rapid increase in size and brightness. it didn't seem to be the right color for a spotlight, and it didn't switch on and switch off. it scaled up and back down in intensity. i didn't see any beam or sweeping light, and it seemed to be too high for a spotlight search. unless it was some sort of lamp that slowly powers up to maximum and back down again, and they only had it on for a few seconds, coincidentally pointed in exactly my direction, i can't explain what it did. i see several planes pass over on regular routes, and we have helicopters that sometimes pass over on route to medical facilities, checking utilities (though not at night), and i've seen some choppers searching with spotlights, which i assume are law enforcement. i even get the occasional low flying double rotor chopper teams flying over late at night, but i've never seen anything similar to what i saw tonight. it was strange enough i thought i should report it.
